title: Kitchen Safety Basics
objectives: Practice safe handling of hot items
instructions: Walk through kitchen identifying potential hazards
Locate fire extinguisher and understand its use
Practice using kitchen towels and mitts safely
Learn proper techniques for carrying knives
Understand basic first aid for minor cuts and burns
Create a checklist for kitchen safety procedures
learningFocus: Kitchen safety fundamentals for injury prevention

title: Knife Safety & Basic Cuts
objectives: Learn proper knife grip and basic safety
instructions: Place cutting board on stable surface with damp towel underneath
Hold knife with proper pinch grip (thumb and forefinger on blade)
Practice the "claw" technique with non-cutting hand
Slice carrot into rounds using controlled motion
Learn proper knife cleaning and storage
Practice safe knife handling and transfers
learningFocus: Safe knife handling and basic cutting techniques

title: Water Boiling Basics
instructions: Select appropriate pot size for intended purpose
Fill pot with correct amount of water
Place on appropriate burner and set to high heat
Observe stages of heating (simmering vs. full boil)
Practice adding salt at the right time
Understand the effects of covering/uncovering the pot
Learn different approaches for different cooking needs
learningFocus: Fundamental heat control and water-based cooking

title: Salt Fundamentals
objectives: Learn proper seasoning techniques using salt
instructions: Compare different salt types visually and by taste
Take a small piece of bread and taste it unseasoned
Add small pinches of salt and taste again
Continue adding tiny amounts until flavor is enhanced but not salty
Repeat the process with egg and vegetable
Note how different foods require different amounts of salt
Practice proper finger pinch technique for salt application
Learn to season from 10-12 inches above food for even distribution
learningFocus: Understanding salt as a basic flavor enhancer

title: Kitchen Organization Basics
instructions: Clear and clean primary work surface
Identify and organize essential tools by frequency of use
Create zones for preparation, cooking, and cleaning
Learn proper cleaning techniques for different surfaces
Set up a simple mise en place system
Create habits for cleaning as you go
Establish a basic organization system for tools and ingredients
learningFocus: Basic kitchen organization and workflow

title: Egg Cooking Basics
instructions: Add small amount of butter or oil
For fried eggs: crack egg into bowl first, then slide into pan
Observe white setting process without browning
Practice flipping technique for over-easy (if desired)
For scrambled: whisk eggs in bowl with pinch of salt
Cook scrambled eggs slowly, stirring frequently
Learn to identify proper doneness (moist but cooked through)
learningFocus: Basic protein cooking using eggs as learning tool

title: Measuring Fundamentals
objectives: Understand difference between volume and weight
instructions: Identify different types of measuring tools and their uses
Practice proper technique for measuring dry ingredients (spoon and level)
Learn correct way to read liquid measures (at eye level)
Understand difference between volume and weight measurement
Learn the importance of consistent measuring
Understand when precision matters and when estimates are acceptable
Practice cleaning and storing measuring tools
learningFocus: Basic measurement techniques for recipe consistency

title: Basic Flavor Understanding
objectives: Understand basic flavor elements (salt, acid, sweet)
instructions: Prepare small portions of plain, underseasoned food
Taste food before any seasoning and note observations
Add small amount of salt, taste again and note differences
Try a few drops of acid (lemon/vinegar), taste and observe
Experiment with small amount of sweetness if appropriate
Learn to identify when a dish needs salt, acid, or sweetness
Create simple flavor balance reference for future cooking
learningFocus: Basic flavor balance principles

title: Ingredient Storage Basics
objectives: Learn proper storage techniques for common ingredients
instructions: Learn appropriate storage locations for different ingredients
Understand which produce should be refrigerated vs. room temperature
Practice proper wrapping/container selection for ingredients
Create simple labeling system with dates
Understand basic shelf life of common ingredients
Learn to identify signs of spoilage
Organize refrigerator and pantry for food safety
learningFocus: Food safety and quality through proper storage

title: Produce Cleaning
objectives: Learn proper cleaning techniques for produce
Understand food safety for raw ingredients
instructions: Sort produce by type (leafy, root, fruit, etc.)
Learn appropriate cleaning method for each type:
- Leafy greens: cold water bath and gentle agitation
- Root vegetables: scrubbing with brush under running water
- Berries/delicate items: gentle rinse and careful drying
Learn to identify signs of spoilage during cleaning
Practice thorough drying of produce after washing
Understand when washing should happen (just before use vs. in advance)
learningFocus: Produce preparation and food safety

title: Basic Dicing Practice
instructions: Set up stable cutting board with damp towel underneath
Prepare vegetables by washing and removing inedible parts
For onion: cut in half, peel, then make parallel cuts without cutting through root end
Make perpendicular cuts to create dice
For carrots: create flat side, cut into planks, then sticks, then dice
For celery: slice stalks lengthwise then crosswise for dice
Focus on consistency rather than speed
Practice claw technique continuously for safety
learningFocus: Fundamental dicing technique for mirepoix basics

title: Perfect Rice
objectives: Learn proper water ratio and timing
instructions: Measure rice accurately using dry measuring cup
Rinse rice in cool water until water runs clear (if needed for variety)
Add appropriate water ratio (typically 1:2 for white rice)
Reduce to lowest simmer and cover tightly
Set timer according to rice type (15-20 mins for white)
Allow to rest covered for 5-10 minutes after cooking
Fluff gently with fork before serving
learningFocus: Basic grain cooking and heat management

title: Pasta Basics
instructions: Fill large pot with water (at least 4 quarts for 1 pound pasta)
Add generous amount of salt (1-2 tablespoons per gallon)
Add pasta and stir immediately to prevent sticking
Set timer for 1-2 minutes less than package directions
Test for doneness by tasting (should be 'al dente' - slight resistance)
Before draining, reserve some pasta water for sauce
Drain promptly when done, but do not rinse (except for pasta salad)
If not using immediately, toss with small amount of oil to prevent sticking
learningFocus: Pasta cooking fundamentals

title: Simple Scrambled Eggs
objectives: Learn proper heat management for eggs
instructions: Crack eggs into bowl and check for shell fragments
Whisk eggs until white and yolk are fully incorporated
Season with small pinch of salt and pepper
Heat non-stick pan over medium-low heat
Add small amount of butter or oil
Pour in eggs when butter stops foaming
Allow eggs to set slightly before gently stirring
Continue stirring occasionally for large, soft curds
Remove from heat when eggs are still slightly wet (they will continue cooking)
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed
learningFocus: Basic protein cookery and gentle heat control

title: Simple Salad
objectives: Practice simple knife cuts for salad
instructions: Wash and thoroughly dry all greens and vegetables
Tear greens into bite-sized pieces (avoid cutting when possible)
Cut vegetables into appropriate sizes for salad
Make simple vinaigrette: 3 parts oil to 1 part vinegar/lemon
Add pinch of salt and pepper to vinaigrette
Toss greens with small amount of dressing just before serving
Add remaining ingredients and toss gently
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed
learningFocus: Fresh ingredient preparation and simple dressing

title: Roasted Vegetables
instructions: Toss with olive oil to coat lightly
Season with salt and optional herbs
Arrange in single layer on baking sheet with space between pieces
Roast until tender and golden brown (about 25-30 minutes)
Test doneness with fork (should pierce easily)
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed
learningFocus: Basic dry heat cooking method

title: Simple Soup
objectives: Create simple soup using basic techniques
instructions: Dice vegetables into small, even pieces
Heat pot over medium heat and add small amount of oil
Add diced vegetables and cook until just softened (3-5 minutes)
Add broth or water and bring to gentle simmer
Season with salt and any desired herbs
Simmer until vegetables are tender (about 15-20 minutes)
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed
Serve hot, adding any finishing touches (herbs, pepper, etc.)
learningFocus: Basic soup construction and gentle simmering

title: Basic Vinaigrette
materials: Small jar with lid or bowl and whisk
instructions: Combine 1 part vinegar/lemon juice with small pinch of salt in jar/bowl
Optional: add small amount of mustard (helps emulsification)
Add 3 parts oil slowly while whisking (or add to jar and shake vigorously)
Taste on a lettuce leaf or vegetable
Adjust acid, oil, or seasonings based on taste
Experiment with optional additions (herbs, honey, etc.)
Learn proper storage (refrigerate, bring to room temp before using)
learningFocus: Basic sauce creation and flavor balancing

title: Simple Breakfast
instructions: Plan components of breakfast (eggs, toast, sides)
Gather and prepare all ingredients before cooking
Coordinate timing to have all items ready together
Cook eggs using preferred method (scrambled, fried)
Prepare toast to coincide with egg completion
Arrange simple fruit or other side
Serve all components at appropriate temperatures
learningFocus: Simple meal coordination and timing

title: Vegetable Soup
instructions: Heat pot over medium heat and add small amount of oil
Add any spices or aromatics and cook briefly
Add broth/water and bring to simmer
Add vegetables in order of cooking time (longest first)
If using, add pre-cooked grains toward end
Simmer until all components are properly cooked
learningFocus: Complete one-pot meal preparation

title: Meal Salad
materials: Protein component (beans, eggs, leftover meat, etc.)
instructions: Wash and thoroughly dry all produce
Prepare greens and vegetables in appropriate sizes
Prepare protein component if cooking is required
Make vinaigrette according to basic recipe
Toast any nuts or seeds if using
Assemble salad starting with greens as base
learningFocus: Complete cold meal preparation and composition

title: Simple Pasta Dinner
materials: Jar of sauce or simple sauce ingredients
instructions: Bring large pot of water to boil for pasta
Begin heating sauce (or prepare simple sauce)
Salt pasta water generously when boiling
Cook pasta according to package directions
If adding vegetables, consider adding to pasta water in last minutes
Reserve small amount of pasta water before draining
Combine pasta with sauce, adding splash of pasta water if needed
learningFocus: Basic multi-component dinner preparation

title: Simple Stir Fry
instructions: Prepare rice in advance or start first
Cut all vegetables and protein into uniform, bite-sized pieces
Make simple stir-fry sauce (soy sauce, water, cornstarch)
Heat wok or pan until very hot
Cook protein first until nearly done, then remove temporarily
Add vegetables in order of cooking time (longest first)
Return protein to pan when vegetables are nearly done
Add sauce and toss until thickened
learningFocus: Quick-cooking technique and ingredient preparation

title: Sheet Pan Dinner
instructions: Cut vegetables into uniform pieces (denser vegetables smaller)
Toss everything with oil and seasonings
Arrange on baking sheet with space between items
Consider timing - add quicker-cooking items later
For proteins with skin, place skin-side up
Roast until protein is safely cooked and vegetables tender
Check halfway through and rotate pan
Allow to rest briefly before serving
learningFocus: Simple complete meal preparation with minimal cleanup

title: Sandwich Meal
instructions: Prepare any ingredients needing cooking (eggs, bacon, etc.)
Slice ingredients appropriately for sandwich construction
Prepare spreads if making from scratch
Apply spreads to bread to protect from moisture
Layer ingredients strategically (moist ingredients separated by dry ones)
Add lettuce/greens last to prevent wilting
Cut sandwich if desired (diagonal for best presentation)
Arrange with side items for complete meal
learningFocus: Simple meal assembly and ingredient preparation

title: Supermarket Exploration
instructions: Visit local supermarket during non-peak hours
Study how produce is organized and displayed
Identify unfamiliar items and research on the spot
Practice selecting quality items (firm vegetables, ripe fruit)
Purchase one unfamiliar ingredient to try at home
learningFocus: Ingredient knowledge and selection skills

title: Kitchen Tool Inventory
instructions: Gather all kitchen tools and equipment
Sort by function (cutting, cooking, measuring, etc.)
Create inventory list with condition notes
Research proper use for unfamiliar tools
Create maintenance schedule for key items
Reorganize based on frequency of use
learningFocus: Kitchen tool knowledge and organization

title: Basic Flavor Exploration
instructions: Prepare small samples of plain food (rice, vegetables, etc.)
Taste each item without seasoning and note observations
Add salt to one sample, taste and note differences
Try acid (lemon juice/vinegar) on another sample
Test small amount of sweetness on another sample
Try combinations of the basic elements
Sample common herbs and spices individually
learningFocus: Sensory development and flavor understanding

title: Kitchen Equipment Survey
objectives: Create a complete inventory of kitchen equipment
instructions: Remove all cooking tools and equipment from storage
Group items by function (cutting, cooking, measuring, etc.)
Clean each item properly according to its material
Note condition and functionality of each item
Create an inventory list with care instructions
Identify missing essential tools for future acquisition
Organize items for optimal workflow when returned to storage
learningFocus: Kitchen equipment knowledge and organization

title: Intermediate Knife Skills
instructions: Review proper knife grip and safety
Practice fine dicing of onions (smaller, more uniform pieces)
Focus on consistency of size and shape
Practice increasing speed while maintaining safety
Learn to maintain better posture while cutting
learningFocus: Refined cutting techniques for improved efficiency

title: Pan Temperature Control
objectives: Learn to identify proper cooking temperatures
instructions: Test different heat settings on your stovetop
Learn visual cues for pan temperature:
Practice adjusting heat up and down quickly
Compare heating properties of different pans (if available)
Test cooking small items at different temperatures
Learn recovery time after adding food to hot pan
Understand relationship between heat setting and pan temperature
learningFocus: Precise heat control for improved cooking results

title: Vegetable Preparation Methods
objectives: Learn proper preparation for different vegetables
instructions: Select 4-5 different vegetables with various preparation needs
Learn specific techniques for each type:
Practice identifying and removing inedible parts
Learn to minimize waste during preparation
Understand how preparation affects cooking time and texture
Practice safe and efficient techniques for each vegetable
learningFocus: Vegetable-specific preparation methods

title: Basic Meal Planning
instructions: Inventory current pantry, refrigerator and freezer items
Create framework for 3-5 days of meals
Consider time availability for each day
Create detailed shopping list organized by store section
Identify prep work that can be batched
Plan for leftovers and ingredient repurposing
Create contingency plan for schedule changes
Estimate overall time and budget requirements
learningFocus: Basic planning and organization for multiple meals

title: Seasoning Methods
instructions: - Pinch and sprinkle from height for even distribution
- Adjust seasoning levels for different foods
- When to add salt (before, during, after cooking)
- When to add herbs (woody herbs early, leafy herbs late)
- When to add spices (toasting vs. finishing)
Develop habit of tasting before and after seasoning
Learn to identify under-seasoning vs. over-seasoning
learningFocus: Deliberate seasoning practice and development

title: Quick Vegetable Prep
objectives: Practice consistent cutting under time pressure
instructions: Set up proper workspace with everything within reach
- Use full length of knife blade
- Stack or group items when possible
Time your preparation and set goals for improvement
Focus on maintaining safety while increasing speed
Practice consistent sizes even when working faster
Learn to minimize waste and maximize yield
Properly store prepped vegetables for future use
learningFocus: Efficiency in vegetable preparation

title: Basic Sautéing
objectives: Learn proper food movement in pan
instructions: Heat pan to proper temperature before adding fat
Add appropriate amount of oil and heat until shimmering
Add food in appropriate quantities (don't overcrowd)
Learn proper tossing or stirring techniques
Understand when to keep food still vs. when to move it
Practice achieving proper browning without burning
Learn to identify doneness through visual cues
Practice removing food at proper time for desired doneness
Adjust heat as needed throughout cooking process
learningFocus: Pan cooking fundamentals

title: Basic Protein Preparation
objectives: Learn proper handling of raw protein
instructions: Learn food safety procedures for working with protein
Practice proper handling to avoid cross-contamination
Learn appropriate cutting techniques for selected protein
If available, use thermometer to verify safe cooking temperature
Practice resting protein after cooking when appropriate
Learn proper storage of leftover cooked protein
learningFocus: Safe protein handling and preparation

title: Mise en Place
instructions: Select recipe that requires multiple ingredients and steps
Read entire recipe thoroughly before beginning
Gather all ingredients, tools, and equipment
Prepare each ingredient completely before starting to cook:
- Measure all liquids and dry goods
Organize prepared ingredients in logical order of use
Ensure workspace is clean and organized
Mentally rehearse cooking process before beginning
Cook with all ingredients pre-prepared and accessible
learningFocus: Preparation organization and workflow

title: Herb and Spice Basics
objectives: Learn basic herb and spice applications
Practice using herbs and spices effectively
instructions: Examine common herbs and spices individually
Note aroma, appearance, and flavor of each
Learn appropriate pairings with different foods
Understand conversion between fresh and dried herbs
Learn timing for adding different herbs and spices:
- Fresh herbs near end or as garnish
Practice toasting whole spices to enhance flavor
Learn proper storage for maximum freshness
Create personal reference guide for future use
learningFocus: Herb and spice fundamentals

title: Advanced Vegetable Preparation
instructions: - Rough chop vs. fine mince for herbs
Practice preparing vegetables for specific cooking methods
Learn specialized techniques (removing corn from cob, etc.)
Time your work and try to improve efficiency
learningFocus: More precise vegetable cutting techniques

title: Pan-Roasted Vegetables
instructions: Add small amount of oil with high smoke point
Arrange vegetables in single layer with space between
Let cook undisturbed until browning begins
Turn pieces to brown on all sides
Adjust heat as needed to maintain caramelization without burning
Test for doneness - tender but not mushy
Finish with fresh herbs or acid if desired
learningFocus: Stovetop roasting technique and caramelization

title: Grain Variations
objectives: Learn to cook different grain types
instructions: Learn appropriate preparation for each (rinsing, soaking, etc.)
Understand proper water-to-grain ratios for each type
Practice cooking method appropriate to each grain
Learn timing differences between grain types
Test for proper doneness for each grain
- Cooking in broth instead of water
Compare taste and texture of different grains
learningFocus: Grain cooking techniques and variations

title: Simple Pan Sauce
instructions: Cook protein in pan, then remove keeping drippings and fond
If needed, pour off excess fat leaving 1-2 teaspoons
Add aromatics (minced shallot, garlic) and cook briefly
Deglaze pan with liquid, scraping up brown bits
Simmer to reduce by about half
Optional: finish with small amount of cold butter or cream
Strain if desired for smooth sauce
learningFocus: Basic sauce from pan drippings

title: Complete Breakfast
instructions: Plan 3+ component breakfast with complementary items
Create timeline working backward from serving time
Prepare mise en place for all components
Prepare components in order of cooking time
Apply appropriate techniques for each item
Coordinate timing for all items to finish together
Serve hot items hot and cold items cold
learningFocus: Multi-component meal coordination

title: Protein with Vegetable Side
objectives: Create complete meal with distinct components
instructions: Select appropriate cooking method for protein
Practice mise en place for entire meal
Prepare vegetable side with appropriate method
Plate attractively with consideration of presentation
learningFocus: Basic two-component meal preparation

title: Grain Bowl
instructions: Cook grain according to appropriate method
Prepare protein component (can be plant or animal-based)
Prepare vegetables in variety of ways (raw, roasted, etc.)
Arrange components in sections over grain
Serve immediately or pack for later
learningFocus: Component-based meal with balance

title: Pan-Cooked Protein with Sauce
instructions: Prepare protein appropriately (seasoning, patting dry, etc.)
Monitor temperature for proper cooking without burning
Test for doneness (visual cues, thermometer if appropriate)
Remove protein and rest if needed
Create pan sauce using fond from protein
Prepare simple side dish to accompany
learningFocus: Pan cooking with sauce creation

title: Complete Stir-Fry Dinner
instructions: Prepare all ingredients before heating pan (crucial):
- Cut protein into uniform, bite-sized pieces
- Cut vegetables into appropriate shapes for quick cooking
- Prepare rice or noodles in advance
Heat wok or pan until very hot
- Cook protein until nearly done, then remove
- Cook vegetables in order of density
- Add sauce and toss until thickened
Serve immediately over rice or noodles
learningFocus: High-heat cooking technique and preparation

title: Complete Roast Dinner
instructions: Prepare protein for roasting (trimming, seasoning, etc.)
Add vegetables to roasting pan at appropriate time
Test protein for doneness using appropriate method
Allow protein to rest before carving
Carve protein and serve with vegetables and sides
learningFocus: Oven roasting technique and timing

title: Ingredient Substitution Exploration
instructions: Select recipe with 1-2 ingredients you want to substitute
Understand the function of the original ingredient:
Identify appropriate substitution with similar function
Adjust amounts as needed based on intensity
Document results and compare to original when possible
Note any unexpected effects of the substitution
Create reference for future substitution needs
learningFocus: Ingredient function and substitution principles

title: Recipe Reading Analysis
instructions: Look for implied steps not explicitly stated
Compare organization and detail level between recipes
Create personal system for recipe annotation
Practice rewriting a recipe in your own format
learningFocus: Recipe comprehension and analysis

title: Cooking Method Comparison
instructions: Select one ingredient to test (e.g., chicken breast, carrots)
Prepare ingredient uniformly for all methods
Apply basic, consistent seasoning across all samples
learningFocus: Cooking method effects on food

title: Leftover Transformation
instructions: - Leftover protein into salad, sandwich, or pasta addition
- Leftover vegetables into soup, frittata, or stir-fry
- Leftover grains into fried rice, grain bowl, or porridge
Consider what additional ingredients are needed
Select appropriate cooking method for transformation
Execute transformation with appropriate food safety
Document successful strategies for future use
learningFocus: Food repurposing and waste reduction

title: Home Cook Level 2 Challenge
instructions: Plan complete meal with protein, starch, and vegetable components
Create detailed timeline for preparation and cooking
Set up mise en place for all components
Apply proper cutting techniques for all ingredients
Cook each component using appropriate method
Coordinate timing for all elements to finish together
Plate attractively with consideration of presentation
Evaluate results for flavor, texture, and overall balance
Document strengths and areas for improvement
learningFocus: Comprehensive application of Home Cook level skills

title: Herb Cutting Techniques
materials: Assorted fresh herbs (parsley, basil, mint, etc.)
objectives: Learn appropriate methods for different herb types
instructions: Wash and thoroughly dry all herbs
Learn to properly remove leaves from woody stems
- Chiffonade (stack, roll, and slice) for larger leaf herbs like basil
- Fine mince for herbs like parsley and cilantro
- Rough chop for hardy herbs like rosemary and thyme
Practice proper hand positioning for safety
Focus on keeping knife skills fluid and efficient
Learn proper herb storage techniques to preserve freshness
learningFocus: Specialized cutting techniques for delicate ingredients

title: Vegetable Blanching
materials: Various vegetables (green beans, broccoli, asparagus, etc.)
objectives: Understand proper timing for different vegetables
instructions: Prepare vegetables by washing and trimming as needed
Bring large pot of water to rolling boil
Add generous amount of salt to water
Prepare ice bath in separate bowl
Add vegetables to boiling water in small batches
Time cooking precisely (typically 1-3 minutes depending on vegetable)
Remove at peak color when vegetables are crisp-tender
Transfer immediately to ice bath to stop cooking
Test for proper texture (should be tender but still have bite)
learningFocus: Quick-cooking technique for optimal texture and color

title: Caramelization Basics
objectives: Practice slow cooking for flavor development
instructions: - Add onions and small pinch of salt
- Add small amount of sugar to clean pan
- Heat over medium until sugar melts
- Remove from heat when amber colored
Compare flavors before and after caramelization
learningFocus: Flavor development through controlled browning

title: Basic Meal Prep
instructions: Plan 2-3 complete meals with overlapping ingredients
Create preparation checklist for all components
- Slightly undercook vegetables that will be reheated
Cool all food properly before storage
Label all containers with contents and date
Organize refrigerator for food safety (ready-to-eat items on top)
Create reheating instructions for each component
learningFocus: Efficient preparation for multiple meals

title: Marinade Fundamentals
instructions: Learn the core components of marinades:
Create basic marinade with balanced proportions
Prepare protein by patting dry and trimming if needed
Apply marinade to completely cover protein
Learn safe marination practices (refrigeration, container material)
Properly clean all tools that contacted raw protein
learningFocus: Flavor infusion and protein preparation

title: Basic Fruit Preparation
materials: Variety of fruits (apple, pineapple, melon, citrus, berries)
instructions: Learn ripeness indicators for different fruits
Practice specialized techniques for each fruit type:
- Citrus: supreme cutting (removing segments without membrane)
- Pineapple: crown and skin removal, core extraction
- Melon: halving, seeding, and slicing methods
Learn proper storage methods for cut fruit
Understand enzymatic browning and prevention methods
learningFocus: Specialized fruit preparation techniques

title: Steaming Technique
materials: Pot with lid or steamer basket
Various vegetables or proteins for steaming
objectives: Master steaming as a cooking technique
Learn proper timing for different foods
instructions: Set up steaming apparatus (basket, rack, or improvised system)
Add appropriate amount of water (not touching food)
Bring water to boil before adding food to steamer
Arrange food in single layer for even cooking
Cover and maintain gentle simmer for steady steam
Time cooking according to food type:
Test for doneness with knife or fork
Remove food promptly to prevent overcooking
learningFocus: Gentle moist-heat cooking method

title: Starch Cooking Methods
materials: Various starches (potatoes, sweet potatoes, corn, winter squash)
instructions: Prepare various starchy vegetables for cooking
Learn optimal cooking method for each type:
- Potatoes: boiling, roasting, and steaming methods
- Sweet potatoes: roasting, steaming, or microwaving
- Winter squash: roasting or steaming techniques
- Corn: boiling, steaming, or roasting methods
Understand appropriate size cuts for even cooking
Practice testing for doneness using knife or fork
Learn seasoning approaches for each starch type
Understand storage methods for cooked starches
learningFocus: Preparing common starch components

title: Kitchen Economy Practices
instructions: Collect vegetable scraps for stock (onion skins, carrot peels, etc.)
Learn proper freezing techniques for various ingredients
Identify multiple uses for common ingredients
- Cheese rinds for flavor in soups
Create storage system for usable scraps
Learn to plan meals to minimize waste
Practice portion control for less waste
Calculate cost savings of waste reduction methods
learningFocus: Economical and sustainable cooking practices

title: Aromatics and Flavor Bases
instructions: Practice proper cutting techniques for each ingredient
Learn appropriate cooking method for each base:
Practice building flavors by adding ingredients in proper sequence
Identify when aromatic base is properly cooked
Learn uses for different flavor bases in various cuisines
learningFocus: Flavor foundation techniques

title: Herb Oil and Vinegar
instructions: - Thoroughly wash and completely dry herbs
- Blanch herbs briefly if using leafy varieties
- Allow to infuse in refrigerator (2-3 days)
- Clean and prepare herbs (no need to blanch)
- Combine herbs and vinegar in clean bottle
- Strain if desired or leave herbs in bottle
learningFocus: Flavor infusion techniques

title: Vegetable Side Variations
materials: Same vegetable type in sufficient quantity
objectives: Learn multiple preparation methods for same vegetable
instructions: Select one vegetable to prepare multiple ways
Prepare each portion using different method:
Use consistent base seasoning (salt, pepper, oil)
Vary finishing elements for each method
Cook each portion to optimal doneness for method
Compare results for flavor, texture, and appearance
Note which method best highlights the vegetable's qualities
learningFocus: Technique variation for ingredient versatility

title: Homemade Stocks
instructions: - For vegetable stock: onion, carrot, celery, herbs, scraps
- For chicken stock: chicken bones, aromatics, herbs
Optional: roast bones or vegetables for deeper flavor
Combine all ingredients in large pot
Cover with cold water (about 2 inches above ingredients)
Maintain gentle simmer for appropriate time:
Skim any foam or impurities as they rise
Cool properly before refrigerating or freezing
learningFocus: Slow flavor extraction technique

title: Grains and Legumes
objectives: Learn to cook dried legumes properly
instructions: Learn sorting and cleaning techniques for dried legumes
- Adding salt at proper time (after softening)
- Learn water ratios for various grains
- Understand cooking times for each type
Create batch preparations for future use
learningFocus: Preparing plant-based protein and nutritious grains

title: Salad with Homemade Dressing
objectives: Create complete meal salad with homemade dressing
instructions: Create comprehensive salad plan with complementary components
Prepare all vegetables with appropriate cutting techniques
Cook any protein components as needed
Create homemade dressing using flavor principles:
- Balance fat, acid, salt, and optional sweetness
- Incorporate herb-infused oil for depth (from S3-1)
- Emulsify properly if using oil and vinegar base
Ensure all components are properly dried
Assemble in proper sequence (greens first, delicate items last)
Garnish with fresh herbs or other accent ingredients
Serve with any additional dressing on the side
learningFocus: Complete meal composition with fresh components

title: Steamed Meal
objectives: Learn steaming timing for multiple components
instructions: Select protein appropriate for steaming (fish, chicken, etc.)
Prepare all components before beginning to cook:
- Cut vegetables to appropriate size for even cooking
- Prepare any sauce or garnish to accompany meal
Create cooking plan based on timing of components
Steam items in order of cooking time (longest first)
Prepare any sauce or accompaniment while items steam
Serve immediately after steaming is complete
learningFocus: Gentle cooking method for complete meal

title: Homemade Soup
instructions: Plan soup style (clear broth, creamy, chunky, etc.)
- Cut vegetables in appropriate sizes for soup type
Adjust consistency if needed (reduce for thicker, add liquid for thinner)
Finish with appropriate garnishes (fresh herbs, acid, etc.)
learningFocus: Building complex flavors in one pot

title: Bean and Grain Bowl
instructions: Plan bowl components for balanced meal:
Prepare any components not already made
Create flavorful sauce to tie components together
Heat any components that should be served warm
Layer components for both appearance and eating functionality
Add sauce and garnishes just before serving
Consider preparing additional components for future bowls
learningFocus: Versatile and nutritious meal assembly

title: Marinated Protein Dinner
objectives: Create complete meal with marinated protein
instructions: Create flavorful marinade using principles from T3-5
Prepare protein and add to marinade
Marinate for appropriate time based on protein type
Create timeline for complete meal preparation
Remove protein from marinade and dry surface if needed
Cook using appropriate method for protein type
Test for doneness properly (thermometer or other indicator)
Allow protein to rest appropriately before slicing
Complete side dishes while protein rests
Serve protein with sides in attractive arrangement
learningFocus: Flavor-infused protein with complete meal

title: Fruit-Based Dessert
instructions: Select appropriate fruits for cooking or serving fresh
Prepare fruits using techniques from T3-6
Choose appropriate cooking method if cooking:
- Sautéing (quick cooking in pan with butter/sugar)
Season with complementary spices and sweetener
Cook until fruits are tender but not mushy
Serve at appropriate temperature (warm or chilled)
learningFocus: Basic dessert principles with fresh ingredients

title: Seasonal Food Research
materials: Access to farmers market or seasonal guides
instructions: Research seasonal foods currently available in your location
Visit local farmers market if available
Document which fruits and vegetables are in peak season
Learn about typical growing seasons in your area
